alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 1:07PM EDT until May 08 at 5:25AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM EDT, flooding was already occurring in the warned area. As of 1245 PM, the gauge on the West Fork of Duck Creek at Macksburg was in minor flood with a reading of 13.9 feet. At stages between 13 and 15 feet Broad Street starts to flood near the creek, homes on the left bank start to flood, and the campground next to the gauge floods. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cat Creek, West Fork Duck Creek, Bear Creek, Right Branch Cat Creek, Pawpaw Creek and East Fork Duck Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
